did.abstract: Peter N. Carroll is a historian and the co-interim chair of the Abraham Lincoln Brigades Archives. This collection consists of educational materials on the Spanish Civil War and materials related to Carroll's research on international brigades in the war, particularly the Abraham Lincoln Brigades. The original donation of this collection remains unprocessed, it includes correspondence, printed material, minutes, and other material related to the ALBA organization. Some correspondence with families of volunteers. Publicity materials (flyers, programs, clippings, etc.) for Spanish Civil War/International Brigades events. Material (reviews, obituaries, etc.) on International Brigades history. Also includes a small number of photographs and audiotapes. In 2018 an accretion was made which primarily includes audio and video recordings as well as digital files on the history of the Spanish Civil War and the International Brigades.
did.langmaterial: Materials are primarily in English, with some materials in Spanish, French, German, and Dutch.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Donated by Peter N. Carroll. The accession numbers associated with this gift are 2011.021 and 2018.132.

arrangement.head: Arrangement
arrangement.p: This collection has not been arranged by an archivist. The materials are arranged in the order in which they were received from the donor.

bioghist.head: Biographical / Historical
bioghist.p: Peter N. Carroll is a historian and the co-interim chair of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade Archives. He is the author and editor of 17 books, primarily on international involvement in the Spanish Civil War. He has taught as a professor at Stanford University and San Francisco State University.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date; Peter Carroll Papers; ALBA 281; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Processing decisions made prior to 2018 have not been recorded. At the time of accessioning, materials associated with Accession number 2018.132 were rehoused in acid-free folders and archival boxes. Born-digital items were separated from the material, boxed, labeled, and inventoried in Medialog.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, printed material, minutes, and other material related to ALBA. Also includes a small number of photographs and audiotapes. These materials are yet to be processed.

In 2018 an accretion was added to this collection, consisting of various videotapes, DVD's, audio tapes, born-digital materials and print newsletters concerning the Spanish Civil War and the activities of the Veterans of the Abraham Lincoln Brigade.

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use
userestrict.p: Copyright (or related rights to publicity and privacy) for some of the materials in this collection was not transferred to New York University. Permission to use materials must be secured from the copyright holder, Peter N. Carroll.

Any rights (including copyright and related rights to publicity and privacy) held by Peter N. Carroll over the materials associated with Accession Number 2018.132 were relinquished and transferred to the public domain in February 2017 by Peter N. Carroll. phystech.head: Physical Characteristics and Technical Requirements
phystech.p: Born-digital materials have not been transferred and may not be available to researchers. Researchers may request access copies. To request that material be transferred, or if you are unsure if material has been transferred, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information

phystech.head: Audiovisual Policies and Procedures
phystech.p: Audiovisual materials have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers. Materials not yet digitized will need to have access copies made before they can be used. To request an access copy, or if you are unsure if an item has been digitized, please contact tamiment.wagner@nyu.edu with the collection name, collection number, and a description of the item(s) requested. A staff member will respond to you with further information.
